|Classify |A new project on Zooniverse where users help classify old scripts written in [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]] and [[Arabic]]. This helps prepare the scripts for annotation. The second phase of this project is being planned to launch in Spring 2018, which includes annotation.{{Cite web|url=https://daily.zooniverse.org/2017/08/08/new-project-scribes-of-the-cairo-geniza/|title=New Project – Scribes of the Cairo Geniza|last=Zooniverse|first=The|date=2017-08-08|website=Daily Zooniverse|access-date=2017-09-03}} This project was launched by [[University of Pennsylvania Libraries]], the Princeton Geniza Project, the [[Jewish Theological Seminary of America|Library of the Jewish Theological Seminary]], and the Genizah at [[Cambridge University Library]]Research Unit .{{cite web|url=https://www.zooniverse.org/projects/judaicadh/scribes-of-the-cairo-geniza/about/team|title=Team that work on the |date=|publisher=|via=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.zooniverse.org/users/JoseAzuajeFidalgo|title= project|date=21 December 2017|publisher=|via=www.zooniverse.org}} |8 Aug 2017 | - |[https://www.zooniverse.org/projects/judaicadh/scribes-of-the-cairo-geniza [1]] |- | |''Modern Muses'' |Annotate |Users can help transcribe letters between [[Lawrence Alloway]] and [[Sylvia Sleigh]]. The current sample includes images of high-[[redshift]] galaxies taken by the [[Hubble Space Telescope]] and low-[[redshift]] galaxies from the [[Sloan Digital Sky Survey]] in [[New Mexico]].{{cite web|title=Spiral, barred, elliptical and irregular: computers automatically classify galaxy shapes|url=http://www.ras.org.uk/news-and-press/157-news2010/1831-spiral-barred-elliptical-and-irregular-computers-automatically-classify-galaxy-shapes|publisher=[[Royal Astronomical Society|RAS]]|accessdate=24 August 2011|date=2 June 2010}} | 12 Jul 2007 | — | [http://www.galaxyzoo.org/] |- | [[File:Solarstormwatch.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''Solar Stormwatch'' | Annotation | The project uses data including video imagery from the twin [[STEREO]] spacecraft to track the formation and evolution of [[coronal mass ejection]]s.{{cite web|title=Humankind sees the Sun as never before|url=http://www.bis.gov.uk/ukspaceagency/news-and-events/2011/Feb/humankind-sees-the-sun|publisher=[[UK Space Agency|UKSA]]|accessdate=24 August 2011|date=7 February 2011}} | 21 Dec 2009 | — | [http://solarstormwatch.com/] |- | [[File:Milky Way Project.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''[[The Milky Way Project]]'' | Annotation | Detecting bubbles in the [[interstellar medium]] which indicate regions where the early stages of star formation are taking place. The project uses infrared images from the [[Spitzer Space Telescope]], as well as sub-millimetre data from [[Herschel Space Telescope|Herschel]].{{cite web|last=Hurt|first=Robert|title=Help Investigate Spitzer's Milky Way!|url=http://www.spitzer.caltech.edu/explore/blog/154-Help-Investigate-Spitzer-s-Milky-Way-|publisher=[[JPL]]|accessdate=23 August 2011|date=7 December 2010}}{{cite web|url=https://blog.milkywayproject.org/2010/12/07/site-goes-live/|title=Site Goes Live|first=|last=ttfnrob|date=7 December 2010|publisher=}} | 7 Dec 2010 | — | [http://www.milkywayproject.org/] |- | [[File:Planethunters.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''[[Planet Hunters]]'' | Annotation | Identifying [[extrasolar planets]] from the [[light curve]]s of stars recorded by the [[Kepler (spacecraft)|Kepler space telescope]].{{cite web|title=NASA's Kepler Mission Announces Next Data Release to Public Archive|url=http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/kepler/news/keplerm-Q3release.html|publisher=[[NASA]]|accessdate=23 August 2011|date=12 August 2011}} | 16 Dec 2010 | — | [http://www.planethunters.org/] |- | [[File:Mars planet four.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''Planet Four'' | Annotation | Analyze images of the surface of Mars, taken near the Martian southern polar cap. Classifications include marking fans and blotches caused by sublimating gas and geysers underneath the carbon dioxide ice. Images come from the HiRISE camera on board the [[Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter]].{{cite web|url=http://www.citizensciencecenter.com/tag/zooniverse/|title=Zooniverse Archives - Citizen Science Center|website=Citizen Science Center}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gizmag.com/planet-four-analyze-mars/25801/ |author=James Holloway|title=Scientists need you to analyise images of Mars|date=15 January 2013|publisher=gizmag|accessdate=15 August 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://hplusmagazine.com/2013/01/16/citizen-science-explore-mars-and-help-planetary-scientists-understand-martian-weather/ |author=Peter Rothman|title=Explore Mars and help planetary scientists understand Martian weather|date=16 January 2013|publisher=Humanity+|accessdate=15 August 2013}}{{cite web|url=https://blog.zooniverse.org/2013/01/08/planet-four-and-stargazing-live/|title=Planet Four and Stargazing Live|first=The|last=Zooniverse|date=8 January 2013|publisher=}} | 8 Jan 2013 | — | [http://www.planetfour.org/] |- | [[File:Radio galaxy zoo.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''[[Radio Galaxy Zoo]]'' | Annotation | Identify radio-wavelength images of [[polar jet|astrophysical jet]]s in galaxies that are powered by accretion onto a [[supermassive black hole|black hole]]. The task is to correctly associate any radio components with an infrared image of the black hole's host [[galaxy]].{{cite web|url=http://www.csiro.au/en/Portals/Media/Find-black-holes-while-youre-on-the-bus.aspx |title=Find black holes while you're on the bus|publisher=CSIRO|accessdate=18 February 2014}} | 17 Dec 2013 | — | [http://radio.galaxyzoo.org/] |- | [[File:HD 113766 circumstellar disk.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''[[Disk Detective]]'' | Filtering | Identify dusty [[debris disk]]s in the [[Milky Way]] galaxy that indicate stars in the process of forming [[planetary system]]s. Images come from NASA's [[Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer|WISE]] telescope, as well as the [[Digitized Sky Survey|DSS2]] and [[2MASS]] surveys.{{cite web|url=http://www.scilogs.com/marketing_for_scientists/launching-disk-detective-a-new-citizen-science-website/|title=Tagebücher der Wissenschaft » SciLogs - Wissenschaftsblogs|website=Tagebücher der Wissenschaft}} | 30 Jan 2014 | — | [http://www.diskdetective.org/] |- | [[File:Sunspotter.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''Sunspotter'' | Ranking | Examine images of [[sunspot]]s and rank pairs of images according to their relative complexity. The science goal is to examine how the complexity of sunspots evolves over time and how they produce eruptions. Data for the project comes from the Michelson Doppler Instrument aboard the [[Solar and Heliospheric Observatory|SOHO]] spacecraft.[https://www.tcd.ie/Communications/news/pressreleases/pressRelease.php?headerID=3567&vs_date=2014-02-27 Press Release - Communications Office - Trinity College Dublin] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140605053008/https://www.tcd.ie/Communications/news/pressreleases/pressRelease.php?headerID=3567&vs_date=2014-02-27 |date=5 June 2014 }}[http://www.science.ie/science-news/sunspotter-project.html Trinity College Dublin launches Citizen Science Project] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140605053350/http://www.science.ie/science-news/sunspotter-project.html |date=5 June 2014 }} | 27 Feb 2014 | — | [http://www.sunspotter.org/] |- | [[File:Avatar asteroids.jpg|100px]] | style="text-align: center;"| ''[[Asteroid Zoo]]'' | Annotation | Examine sets of time-lapsed images to search for moving objects that could be undiscovered [[asteroid]]s.
